title: Sri Lanka cruise to six-wicket win over Bangladesh in Asia Cup T20
byline: Former champions Sri Lanka launched their Asia Cup campaign in emphatic fashion on Sunday, cruising to a six-wicket victory over Bangladesh in Abu Dhabi.

title: Police and protesters scuffle as 110,000 join anti-migrant London protest
byline: More than 100,000 protesters marched through central London on Saturday, carrying flags of England and Britain and scuffling with police in one of the UK’s biggest right-wing demonstrations of modern times.

title: Severed body found on Marawila beach
byline: Marawila Police said that a body, missing its head, arms, and legs, was found on Marawila Mudu Katuwa Beach, with only a portion of the torso clad in blue shorts remaining.

title: Airport security chief arrested for Attempted gold smuggling
byline: A Chief Security Officer at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) was arrested by airport customs officers on Sunday morning for attempting to smuggle gold biscuits worth Rs. 215 million.

title: MP Nalin Bandara criticizes government’s first-year performance
byline: Samagi Jana Balaya MP Nalin Bandara has criticized the current government’s pace of work, saying it is too slow to develop the country effectively.

title: Couple rides six hours to see Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: A couple from Galgamuwa, Kurunegala, undertook a six-hour motorcycle journey to Tangalle to visit former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at his Carlton House residence.

title: Middeniya chemical stash confirmed as ICE production material
byline: Chemicals found in Middeniya have been identified as key ingredients for producing methamphetamine (ICE), the National Dangerous Drugs Control Board confirmed.

title: Public urged to stay hydrated as heat index rises
byline: The Department of Meteorology has cautioned that the Heat Index — the temperature felt on the human body — is expected to climb to the ‘Caution level’ in parts of the Northern, North-Central and Eastern Provinces, as well as in the Moneragala district.

title: Six candidates to contest Diyawadana Nilame selection of Sri Dalada Maligawa
byline: The number of candidates contesting the upcoming election for the position of Diyawadana Nilame of the historic Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy has risen to six.

title: Buddhism should be safeguarded to preserve sovereignty: Sajith
byline: Buddhism should be preserved in order to safeguard the sovereignty of the country, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: CAA conducts nearly 3,000 raids over rice trade violations this year
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) said that nearly 3,000 raids have been conducted so far this year in connection with irregularities in the rice trade.

title: Government to establish 1,000 community health centers within three years
byline: A network of community health centers will be established across the country to provide early diagnosis, treatment, follow-up care, and referrals to hospitals, Health Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Education Ministry issues 2026 examination schedule
byline: The Education Ministry has released the examination timetable for the year 2026.

title: Long-distance buses to face mandatory quality inspections from October
byline: The government will launch a new initiative requiring all long-distance buses to undergo a basic quality inspection before commencing operations, with effect from October, the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) said.

title: Kadawatha–Mirigama Expressway work to resume on September 17
byline: Construction work on section of the Central Expressway between Kadawatha and Mirigama, which had been stalled since mid-2022 due to the economic crisis, will resume on September 17.

title: PAFFREL urges Govt. to expedite Provincial Council elections
byline: The People’s Action for Free and Fair Elections (PAFFREL) has called on the government to take immediate steps to hold the long-delayed Provincial Council elections, stressing that the continued delay has undermined democratic rights.

title: Report on recovered chemicals linked to ’ice’  submitted to police
byline: A detailed report has been handed over to the police regarding the container containing chemicals allegedly used in the manufacture of crystal methamphetamine, commonly known as ’ice,’ discovered in Middeniya.

title: Trump ’ready’ to sanction Russia if Nato nations stop buying its oil
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he is ready to impose tougher sanctions on Russia, but only if Nato countries meet certain conditions which include stopping buying Russian oil.

title: Circular permitting bus decorations cancelled
byline: The Commissioner General of Motor Traffic announced that the circular allowing the use of decorations and accessories on passenger buses has been cancelled.

title: South Africa inflict record defeat on New Zealand
byline: New Zealand suffered their biggest defeat in history as they were beaten 43-10 by South Africa in the Rugby Championship in Wellington.
